title: The first full-length trailer of The Crown shows a royal family in turbulence
text:
The new trailer for the third season of the The Crown was released today, portraying a crumbling and fractured Britain and a self-doubting Queen.

Written by Peter Morgan, who also wrote seasons one and two, the third season stars Oscar-winner Olivia Colman as Queen Elizabeth, Helena Bonham Carter as Princess Margaret, Tobias Menzies as The Duke of Edinburgh, Josh O'Connor as Prince Charles, Erin Doherty as Princess Anne, Ben Daniels as Lord Snowdon, Jason Watkins as Prime Minister Harold Wilson and Charles Dance as Lord Mountbatten.

While the first and second seasons, which starred Matt Smith and Claire Foy as Prince Philip and the Queen, covered between 1947-63 (and ended on the Profumo affair), the third and fourth seasons will chart the years 1964-76, from cold war paranoia to the space age, via decolonisation and Labour prime minister Harold Wilson’s rise to power.

There will, of course, be plenty of internal drama, as the trailer depicts growing turbulence within the royal fold.

"On days like today, ask yourself in the time I've been on the throne what have I actually achieved?" Queen Elizabeth asks herself as she prepares for her Silver Jubilee.

The Prince of Wales, meanwhile, receives hard-hitting advice: "Never turn your back on true love, and watch out for your family." When he replies, "They mean well," he is told, "No, they don't."
